results.title: Esther
results.brief_description:
Recorded at the Eglise Saint-Germain during the Festival du Marais. ‘Esther’ (1689) is a biblical tragedy complete with musical choral interludes composed by Jean-Baptiste Moreau, who would serve in this same role for Racine’s last play, Athalie. The play shows how Esther, the wife of the Persian king Ahasuerus (Xerxes I), saves the Jews from a massacre plotted by the king’s chief minister, Haman. With its three acts, chorus and transcendent message that God and truth can be made manifest on stage, Esther breaks sharply with Racine’s previous practice in tragedy. It is not one of his major works, despite the beauty of its choruses.” Reference: Encyclopedia Britanica. Online; http://www.eb.com

Credits: Director, Dominique Delouche ; photography, Emanuel Machuel ; music, Jean-Baptiste Moreau.
Cast: Andre Falcon, Liliane Nataf, Julien Bertheau, Claude Brosset.

results.title: Erotic ghost story [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ngai Kai Lam, Lan Chan Choi and Diagonal Pictures
results.brief_description: Three beautiful sisters are really Chinese “fox fairies” who have been granted mortal form in return for doing good deeds. If they resist the temptations of the mortal world, they can eventually achieve immortality. One by one, they each meet a mysterious handsome scholar and make wild, abandoned love with him (and occasionally with each other). Each of the sisters deceives the others about their activities, but eventually they all suspect each other. And when fox hair begins to grow on their bodies, the truth is out. They go to confront the scholar, only to find that he is the god of Carnal Desire, Wu Tung. Basically a soft-porn comedy that also features lush cinematography and costumes, and impressive fight sequences. Cast includes Amy Yip, Man Siu, Pal Sin and Kamimura Kyoko. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Erikson on Erikson: on developmental stages
results.creator_credit: Thomas Sand and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: Conversation between Erikson and a group of students at the Erikson Institute, edited from 5 hours of tapes. Deals mostly with the eight stages of human development: everyone’s successive steps of development from birth through adulthood and old age, each one leading to certain gains, and laden with its own specific conflicts.

group_works.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
group_works.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier

results.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
results.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “European Community”.
Deals with the notion of equal work for equal pay. Shows examples of women employed in non-traditional jobs. Encourages girls to look at all areas of employment and suggests that equality of job opportunity should begin at school.

results.title: Epileptic seizure patterns
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the historic ideas about epilepsy and a description of modern methods of diagnosis, showing patients undergoing seizures of varying degrees of intensity, during which psychological changes are observed. The convulsions are correlated with an EEG graph.

results.title: Epilepsy: Yes! You can help
results.brief_description: Affecting one or two people in every 100, epilepsy manifests itself through three different kinds of seizures - tonic colonic, absence and complex partial. Using dramatised re-enactments and discussions with sufferers, this short program describes what it’s like to suffer an attack and what you can do if you witness one. Narrated by Nina Landis.
